Title: RHSA-2019:3345: virt:rhel security, bug fix, and enhancement update (Low)
Description:
Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM) offers a full virtualization solution for Linux on numerous hardware platforms. The virt:rhel module contains packages which provide user-space components used to run virtual machines using KVM. The packages also provide APIs for managing and interacting with the virtualized systems.

Security Fix(es):

* ntfs-3g: heap-based buffer overflow leads to local root privilege escalation (CVE-2019-9755)

* QEMU: slirp: information leakage in tcp_emu() due to uninitialized stack variables (CVE-2019-9824)

* QEMU: qxl: null pointer dereference while releasing spice resources (CVE-2019-12155)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.1 Release Notes linked from the References section.

Bugzillas.Title: [RFE] add iommu support to virtio-gpu
Boot guest with device assignment+vIOMMU, qemu prompts "vtd_interrupt_remap_msi: MSI address low 32 bit invalid: 0x0" when first rebooting guest
Modify iotest behavior to include  luks and nbd and fail build if iotests fail
Fail to launch AMD SEV VM with assigned PCI device
Local VM and migrated VM on the same host can run with same RAW file as visual disk source while without shareable configured or lock manager enabled
qemu-kvm core dumped after hotplug the deleted disk with iothread parameter
Qemu core dump when start guest with two disks using same drive
CVE-2019-9824 QEMU: slirp: information leakage in tcp_emu() due to uninitialized stack variables

qemu-img convert abort when converting image with unaligned size (qemu-img: block/io.c:2134: bdrv_co_block_status: Assertion `*pnum && (((*pnum) % (align)) == 0) && align > offset - aligned_offset\' failed)
Use a better icon for RHEL 7+ guests
virt-inspector fails with "error: int_of_string" on a Linux image when /etc/fstab contains a partionless device
severe performance impact using luks format
libvirt: Can't create ppc64 guests with graphics and no USB mouse
qemu crashed when take screenshot for 2nd head of virtio video device if the display not opened by virt-viewer
Guest will be destroyed if autostarted pool is destroyed and libvirtd restarted
Enhance detection of host CPU model to avoid guesses based on fea.ture list length
qemu aborted when start guest with a big iothreads
[Intel 8.1 BUG][KVM][Crystal Ridge]object_get_canonical_path_component: assertion failed: (obj->parent != NULL)
Include of the updated rhev-apt in virt-v2v
RFE: rewrite cgroups code to support v2 subsystem
Network filters are not honouring explicitly listed parameters for MAC
CVE-2019-9755 ntfs-3g: heap-based buffer overflow leads to local root privilege escalation
virsh nodedev-list --cap net can not list all the network device when modprobe ib_umad
[RFE] - libvirt support for cascade lake cpu - Slow Train
QEMU image locking needn't double open fd number, and it should not fail when attempting to release locks
CPU mode=host-model needs to include MSR features
Live migration fail with unsafe error when GPFS is used as shared filesystem
implement missing reset handler for cfi.pflash01 - slow train
qemu-iotest 182 fails without device hotplugging support
/builddir/build/BUILD/qemu-2.12.0/target/i386/kvm.c:2031: kvm_put_msrs: Assertion `ret == cpu->kvm_msr_buf->nmsrs' failed.
Incorrect capacity and allocation fields in iscsi pool XML
CVE-2019-12155 QEMU: qxl: null pointer dereference while releasing spice resources
src packages are listed in virt rhel module for RHEL8.0.0.1 and there are some problems about version checking with virt rhel module.
qemu-kvm build is broken due to spice_qxl_set_max_monitors being deprecated
Disable VXHS  in qemu-kvm
Qemu Core dump when quit vm that's in status "paused(io-error)" with data plane enabled
internal error: Failed to parse bitmap '' when starting guest
'cannot set CPU affinity' error when starting guest
libvirt still doesn't relabel sockets in nbd: backing URLs
VM failed to start with error "failed to install seccomp syscall filter in the kernel"
virsh command delay issue on DPDK node
qemu-kvm can't be build with new gluster version (6.0.6)
Do not require glusterfs on i686
Fix build with current libssh
Failed to convert a source image to the qcow2 image encrypted by luks
libvirtd crashes non deterministically when trying to destroy a guest
'qemu-io write' to a raw image over libgfapi fails
Hot unplug vfio-pci NIC devices from sev guest will cause qemu-kvm: sev_ram_block_removed: failed to unregister region
Please backport upstream libvirt commit 87b4e1cd7e7e ("docs: schemas: Decouple the virtio options from each other", 2019-01-04)
enable the virtio-net frontend to work with the vhost-net backend in SEV guests
improve error message "error: internal error: Duplicate key"
I/O error when virtio-blk disk is backed by a raw image on 4k disk
virt-v2v: Use scp -T in -i vmx -it ssh mode
Disable memfd in QEMU
[cgroup_v2] Error happened and xml not changed when use blkiotune to set blk cgroup values
[cgroup_v2] Cannot get and set cpu cgroup params due to cpu.max error
Remove iotests from qemu-kvm builds [RHEL 8.1.0]
Backport support for count cache flush Spectre v2 mitigation [slow train]
"filtered-features" QOM property is not available
[cgroup_v2] Crash happens when set cpu related cgroup values by “schedinfo”
[cgroup_v2] schedinfo cmd cannot set vcpu/emulator/global/iothread period values
